docs.title: Albert Einstein
docs.text: Albert Einstein (1879-1955) was a German-born theoretical physicist. He published the special theory of relativity in 1905. The general theory of relativity was published in 1915. Einstein won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.
docs.passage:
Albert Einstein
Albert Einstein (1879-1955) was a German-born theoretical physicist. He published the special theory of relativity in 1905. The general theory of relativity was published in 1915. Einstein won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

docs.title: Theory of Relativity
docs.text: The theory of relativity revolutionized physics. It consists of special relativity and general relativity. Special relativity deals with objects moving at constant speeds, while general relativity describes gravity.
docs.passage:
Theory of Relativity
The theory of relativity revolutionized physics. It consists of special relativity and general relativity. Special relativity deals with objects moving at constant speeds, while general relativity describes gravity.

docs.title: Eiffel Tower
docs.text: The Eiffel Tower is located in Paris, France. It was completed in 1889. The tower is one of the most recognizable structures in the world and a symbol of France.
docs.passage:
Eiffel Tower
The Eiffel Tower is located in Paris, France. It was completed in 1889. The tower is one of the most recognizable structures in the world and a symbol of France.

docs.title: Paris
docs.text: Paris is the capital city of France. It is known as the City of Light. Paris is famous for its art, culture, and landmarks like the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre Museum.
docs.passage:
Paris
Paris is the capital city of France. It is known as the City of Light. Paris is famous for its art, culture, and landmarks like the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre Museum.

docs.title: Sherlock Holmes
docs.text: Sherlock Holmes is a fictional detective created by Arthur Conan Doyle. The character first appeared in 1887. Holmes is known for his logical reasoning and attention to detail.
docs.passage:
Sherlock Holmes
Sherlock Holmes is a fictional detective created by Arthur Conan Doyle. The character first appeared in 1887. Holmes is known for his logical reasoning and attention to detail.

docs.title: Arthur Conan Doyle
docs.text: Arthur Conan Doyle was a British writer. He created the character Sherlock Holmes. Doyle wrote many stories featuring Holmes and his assistant Dr. Watson.
docs.passage:
Arthur Conan Doyle

docs.title: Steve Jobs
docs.text: Steve Jobs co-founded Apple Inc. in 1976. He was the CEO of Apple until 2011. Jobs was known for his innovation in personal computing and mobile devices.
docs.passage:
Steve Jobs
Steve Jobs co-founded Apple Inc. in 1976. He was the CEO of Apple until 2011. Jobs was known for his innovation in personal computing and mobile devices.

docs.title: Apple Inc.
docs.text: Apple Inc. is a technology company. The first iPhone was released in 2007. Apple is known for its innovative products including the iPhone, iPad, and Mac computers.
docs.passage:
Apple Inc.

docs.title: Marie Curie
docs.text: Marie Curie was a Polish-French physicist. She discovered the elements polonium and radium. Curie was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize and the only person to win Nobel Prizes in two different sciences.
docs.passage:
Marie Curie
Marie Curie was a Polish-French physicist. She discovered the elements polonium and radium. Curie was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize and the only person to win Nobel Prizes in two different sciences.

docs.title: Polonium
docs.text: Polonium is a chemical element with symbol Po. It was discovered by Marie Curie in 1898. Polonium is a radioactive element named after Curie's homeland of Poland.
docs.passage:
Polonium
Polonium is a chemical element with symbol Po. It was discovered by Marie Curie in 1898. Polonium is a radioactive element named after Curie's homeland of Poland.

docs.title: Solar System
docs.text: The solar system consists of the Sun and planets. Mercury is the closest planet to the Sun. The solar system also includes asteroids, comets, and other celestial bodies.
docs.passage:
Solar System
The solar system consists of the Sun and planets. Mercury is the closest planet to the Sun. The solar system also includes asteroids, comets, and other celestial bodies.

docs.title: Mercury
docs.text: Mercury is the smallest planet in the solar system. It orbits closest to the Sun. Mercury has extreme temperature variations due to its proximity to the Sun.
docs.passage:
Mercury

docs.title: Amazon Rainforest
docs.text: The Amazon rainforest is located in South America. It is the largest tropical rainforest in the world. The rainforest is home to millions of species of plants and animals.
docs.passage:
Amazon Rainforest
The Amazon rainforest is located in South America. It is the largest tropical rainforest in the world. The rainforest is home to millions of species of plants and animals.

docs.title: Amazon River
docs.text: The Amazon River is the longest river in South America. It flows through the Amazon rainforest. The river is one of the longest rivers in the world.
docs.passage:

docs.title: Mona Lisa
docs.text: The Mona Lisa is a famous painting by Leonardo da Vinci. It is displayed in the Louvre Museum in Paris. The painting is known for its mysterious smile and artistic technique.
docs.passage:
Mona Lisa

docs.title: Leonardo da Vinci
docs.text: Leonardo da Vinci was an Italian Renaissance artist. He painted the Mona Lisa between 1503 and 1519. Da Vinci was also a scientist, inventor, and engineer.

docs.title: Mount Everest
docs.text: Mount Everest is located on the border between Nepal and China. It is the highest mountain in the world. The first successful ascent was in 1953 by Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay.
docs.passage:

docs.title: Nepal
docs.text: Nepal is a country in South Asia. Kathmandu is the capital city of Nepal. Nepal is home to Mount Everest and many other Himalayan peaks.

docs.title: Laws of Motion
docs.text: The laws of motion were formulated by Isaac Newton. They describe the motion of objects and planets. Newton's three laws of motion are fundamental principles of classical mechanics.
docs.passage:
Laws of Motion

docs.title: Isaac Newton
docs.text: Isaac Newton was an English physicist and mathematician. He formulated the laws of motion and universal gravitation. Newton's work laid the foundation for classical physics.
docs.passage:
Isaac Newton
